title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki on 28 October 2013 - XWiki
content:
<evalica> has joined #xwiki  
07:20 <mflorea> has joined #xwiki  
07:33 <evalica> has quit  
07:34 <sburjan`> has quit  
07:35 <sburjan`> has joined #xwiki  
08:14 <sburjan`> has quit  
08:14 <sburjan`> has joined #xwiki  
08:32 <msmeria> has joined #xwiki  
08:34 <tmortagne> has joined #xwiki  
08:51 <evalica> has joined #xwiki  
09:16 <sburjan> has joined #xwiki  
09:17 <j-simard> has joined #xwiki  
09:31 <Denis1> has joined #xwiki  
09:32 <Denis1> is now known as <Denis>  
09:57 <camil7> has joined #xwiki  
10:06 <gdelhumeau> has joined #xwiki  
10:30 <KermitTheFragger> has joined #xwiki  
10:36 <vmassol> has joined #xwiki  
10:37 <vmassol> good morning (sorry I hadn't realized I wasn't connected this morning)  
10:43 <mflorea> vmassol, gdelhumeau: you have issues closed for 5.3M1 that are missing documentation. Please take care of them asap. Thanks.  
10:43 <vmassol> ok thanks mflorea  
10:45 <vmassol> wow I have 6...  
10:45 <vmassol> going to be a doc day for me today ;)  
10:45 <mflorea> :)  
10:46 <gdelhumeau> bugs should be documented too?  
10:46 <gdelhumeau> or only improvments ?  
10:46 <vmassol> no  
10:46 <vmassol> unless they're important enough to be in the RN  
10:46 <vmassol> to warn the user  
10:46 <vmassol> for ex when there's backward compat breakage  
10:47 <vmassol> but yes improvements/feature must be documented  
10:48 <mflorea> sometimes fixing a bug involves changing something on the UI. So IMO if the change is significant it should be mentioned in the release notes, but generally bug fixes are not documented  
10:52 <gdelhumeau> mflorea: I have fixed XWIKI-9489.  
10:52 <vmassol> you can have a one liner for it in misc for users  
10:52 <vmassol> since it brings some visual changes  
10:53 <gdelhumeau> That's what I have done ;)  
10:54 <vmassol> yup  
10:59 <mflorea> gdelhumeau: thanks  
11:16 <j-simard> has quit  
11:19 <j-simard> has joined #xwiki  
11:27 <vmassol> hmm actually our maven plugins should be documented on exo  
11:27 <vmassol> moving the doc  
11:27 <vmassol> wdyt?  
11:27 <vmassol> tmortagne, mflorea: any take on this?  
11:27 <vmassol> it's not really user facing this is why I'm hesitating  
11:28 <tmortagne> vmassol: it depends what user you are talking about  
11:28 <tmortagne> it's used by contributors  
11:28 <tmortagne> so not only "us"  
11:28 <vmassol> sure but ATM all extensions are for xwiki users  
11:28 <vmassol> (not developers of xwiki solutions)  
11:29 <vmassol> well anyway I think it's a good thing  
11:29 <vmassol> so you agree?  
11:29 <vmassol> s/so/do  
11:30 <vmassol> hmm  
11:30 <vmassol> actually it's not really an extension  
11:30 <vmassol> it's a maven artifact  
11:30 <vmassol> but not an xwiki extension  
11:30 <vmassol> so in the end it's probabmy not a good place :)  
11:30 <tmortagne> yes it's not a XWiki extension as in Extension Manager  
11:31 <vmassol> I'll leave it in http://dev.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Community/XARPlugin for now  
12:04 <cjd> has quit  
12:08 <gdelhumeau> How should I call my the space that will contain the UI for the managment of wikis?  
12:08 <gdelhumeau> Wiki Manager was the space used for the old Wiki Manager UI (which will be deprecated but not deleted)  
12:09 <gdelhumeau> "Wiki" seems too generic and the user may want to use it  
12:09 <gdelhumeau> "WikiUI" is weid  
12:09 <gdelhumeau> any idea?  
12:11 <vmassol> gdelhumeau: why not reuse the same space as before? Do you have name clashes?  
12:12 <gdelhumeau> I don't want to use "WorkspaceManager" anymore, and yes, "WebHome" for example...  
12:12 <gdelhumeau> I think "WikiManager" is the best name  
12:12 <vmassol> why would you want to keep the old WebHome?  
12:12 <gdelhumeau> but it means we can't have both the new app and the old one  
12:13 <vmassol> I don't understand why you want to keep the old pages?  
12:13 <mflorea> has quit  
12:14 <vmassol> shouldn't the old app be wrapped by the new app?  
12:14 <vmassol> (wrapped in the sense of EM)  
12:14 <gdelhumeau> yes, it should be  
12:14 <vmassol> it's an open question, I have not thought at all about it  
12:20 <cjd> has joined #xwiki  
12:22 <tmortagne> gdelhumeau: given the feature of your new module it's useless to keep old WikiManager IMO  
12:22 <tmortagne> so you can reuse it  
12:23 <gdelhumeau> ok  
12:23 <tmortagne> if someone want the old one he can always install the 5.1 version  
12:23 <tmortagne> 5.2  
12:23 <tmortagne> there is no reason for us to continue support it  
12:27 <cjd> has quit  
12:27 <vmassol> gdelhumeau: will there still be a wiki-api module in the future?  
12:28 <vmassol> I mean  
12:28 <vmassol> wiki-descriptor-api  
12:28 <cjd> has joined #xwiki  
12:28 <vmassol> if i remember you want to move that into wiki-api right?  
12:28 <vmassol> (and not have a module dedicated to descriptors anymore)  
12:28 <gdelhumeau> exactly  
12:29 <gdelhumeau> the descriptor manager is a part of the wiki-api  
12:29 <vmassol> ok then I'll let you create the documentation module for it  
12:29 <vmassol> :)  
12:29 <vmassol> as otherwise it'll jsut be removed  
12:29 <tmortagne> vmassol: GG  
12:29 <vmassol> :)  
12:33 <sdumitriu> has quit
